summary:
The Age of Discovery was a time from the 15th to 17th centuries when European explorers sailed the oceans, discovering new lands and people. It began with Portuguese voyages to the Canary Islands and West Africa. Famous trips include Christopher Columbus's journey to the Americas and Ferdinand Magellan's global circumnavigation.

This era connected different parts of the world, starting global trade and colonization. It led to the exchange of plants, animals, and cultures between the Old and New Worlds. European maps improved, showing continents as we know them today. However, it also brought diseases and hardship to many native populations.
title: Age of Discovery
